ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: less than 1
none
0 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: good

We only have met once this semester, but it was awesome. I really enjoyed the speaker. The only weakness I can think of is that I'd love to meet more often! And the time on Monday is not always the easiest to make because I had a class at 1pm.
This was a lunch seminar that only met twice during the semester, so there's not much to say. Strengths: free lunch, interesting talks.
The course would be improved by adding additional sessions.
Good speakers, would have been good to know the second scheduled seminar had been cancelled.

The speakers were great and the topics they covered were very interesting, but unfortunately they went over my head. I talked with quite a few classmates about it and we just felt lost and confused with many of the topics. Because we just need to sit and listen, it's not a big deal, but I would have much rather been able to apply what I had learned in Cost-Effectiveness to the real world rather than be inundated with very advanced techniques.
Fantastic! The speakers were great!
Interesting topics, but perhaps too infrequent.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: A David Paltiel  good
Instructor: A David Paltiel  Dr. Paltiel is the best. He's awesome. Literally no weaknesses. Just so great.
Instructor: A David Paltiel  He's great!
Instructor: A David Paltiel  I love David, but this is a seminar composed of talks from other lecturers, so he doesn't have much to do with teaching it.
Instructor: A David Paltiel  Chose great speakers!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Seminars never happen. Last one was cancelled but no one knew, can be confusing.
good
AWESOME. Everyone should take it, even if they don't want to do the modeling concentration.
Seminars are well spaced and interesting
Required for the modeling concentration, so chances are you'll be taking it either way. Very low effort required, just show up 2 or 3 times in a semester.
Three one-hour sessions per semester to see how modeling is used in Public Health and related areas in the real world.
Learn about modeling!
